com.blukii.sdk.config

Class SmartKey

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blukii.sdk.config.Blukii
      • com.blukii.sdk.config.SmartKey

  • public final class SmartKey
extends Blukii

    Controller class for connection based communication with blukii devices of type SmartKey.



    This class contains additional requests that are specific for blukii SmartKeys.

    See also class SmartKey.OnConnectionListener that contains SmartBeacon corresponding callbacks.

    Please following the instructions of the quick start documentation of base class Blukii.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SmartKey.OnConnectionListener
      Abstract class for callbacks of SmartKey specific requests.

    • Method Detail

      • initiateAuthentication

        public void initiateAuthentication()
        Initiates the authentication in pairing and secure mode.

        The authentication depends on the actual SmartKey security mode:
        • Pairing mode: the master is sending a pairing key encrypted authentication request.
        • Secure mode: the master is requesting the authentication by a multi-stage challenge response process. The communication is encrypted by the cryptographic key that has been set in background by calling writeModeSecure(int).
        • Convenience mode: no authentication supported.


        Note: master and SmartKey have to be paired.

        The request status is returned on callback SmartKey.OnConnectionListener.onInitiateSmartKeyAuthentification(boolean, byte).
        See Also:
        readMode(), writeModePairing(int), writeModeSecure(int)

      • readButton

        public void readButton()
        Reads the actual state of the SmartKey button.

        Note: this request is only valid, if the SmartKey is successfully authenticated.

        See SmartKey.OnConnectionListener.onReadSmartKeyButton(boolean, byte) for more information.

        The response data is returned on callback SmartKey.OnConnectionListener.onReadSmartKeyButton(boolean, byte) .

      • readMode

        public void readMode()
        Reads the security mode of the SmartKey.

        See SmartKey.OnConnectionListener.onReadSmartKeyMode(int, byte) for more information.

        The response data is returned on callback SmartKey.OnConnectionListener.onReadSmartKeyMode(int, byte) .

      • readSmartKeyCommandSet

        public void readSmartKeyCommandSet()
        Reads the availability of requests concerning blukii settings.

        The response data is returned on callback SmartKey.OnConnectionListener.onReadSmartKeyCommandSet(int, byte).

        See SmartKey.OnConnectionListener.onReadSmartKeyCommandSet(int, byte) for more information.

      • writeButton

        public void writeButton(int frames)
        Writes the number of advertised SmartKey button flags.

        If the SmartKey button is pushed, a corresponding flag is set on the SmartKey advertising frame. Use this request for setting the amount of frame that will contain this flag.

        The request status is returned on callback SmartKey.OnConnectionListener.onWriteSmartKeyButton(byte).
        Parameters:
        frames - amount of frames with activate SmartKey button flag.
        See Also:
        readButton()

      • writeModeConvenience

        public void writeModeConvenience()
        Sets the security mode to SETTING_MODE_CONVENIENCE.

        On this mode the SmartKey is sending nonconnectable advertising frames so you only can connect in service mode (see below).

        Use this mode for low security: the master can identify the blukii by reading the advertising packages.

        Note: this request is only available in service mode that is running 30 seconds after re-inserting the battery.

        The request status is returned on callback SmartKey.OnConnectionListener.onWriteSmartKeyModeConvenience(byte).
        See Also:
        readMode()

      • writeModePairing

        public void writeModePairing(int pairingKey)
        Sets the security mode to SETTING_MODE_PAIRING.

        Use this mode for medium security: the master can identify the blukii by doing the following steps:
        • Ensure master and blukii are paired
        • Connect to blukii
        • Try to authenticate (see initiateAuthentication() for more information)


        On pairing mode the communication is encrypted by the pairing key.

        It is recommended to call Blukii.writeBlukiiInitiatePairing() after running this request and to release the connection.

        Note: this request is only available in service mode that is running 30 seconds after re-inserting the battery.

        The request status is returned on callback SmartKey.OnConnectionListener.onWriteSmartKeyModePairing(byte).
        Parameters:
        pairingKey - 6-digit pairing key (000000 - 999999)
        See Also:
        readMode(), initiateAuthentication(), Blukii.writeBlukiiInitiatePairing()

      • writeModeReset

        public void writeModeReset()
        Resets the security mode to SETTING_MODE_OFF.

        On this mode the SmartKey is sending connectable advertising frames.

        It is recommended to use this mode for changing general Bluetooth oder blukii settings (see requests of base class Blukii).

        Note: this request is only available in service mode that is running 30 seconds after re-inserting the battery.

        The request status is returned on callback SmartKey.OnConnectionListener.onWriteSmartKeyModeReset(byte).
        See Also:
        readMode()

      • writeModeSecure

        public void writeModeSecure(int pairingKey)
        Sets the security mode to SETTING_MODE_SECURE.

        Use this mode for high security: the master can identify the blukii by doing the following steps:
        • Ensure master and blukii are paired
        • Connect to blukii
        • Try to authenticate (see initiateAuthentication() for more information)


        On secure mode the communication is encrypted by the pairing key and an additional cryptographic key exchange.

        It is recommended to call Blukii.writeBlukiiInitiatePairing() after running this request and to release the connection.

        Note: this request is only available in service mode that is running 30 seconds after re-inserting the battery.

        The request status is returned on callback SmartKey.OnConnectionListener.onWriteSmartKeyModeSecure(byte).
        Parameters:
        pairingKey - 6-digit pairing key (000000 - 999999)
        See Also:
        readMode(), initiateAuthentication(), Blukii.writeBlukiiInitiatePairing()
